ratings.comment: kinda all over the place w pointless lectures, v self-involved, tries hard to be "fun"....easy a but annoying

Adell is a real gem.
Hilarious lectures, don't have to take notes, she plays video clips and shares personal stories.
You read a book every week or every other week but just need one short talking point each class. Only 4 paper assignments, she gives great feedback, gives extensions. 
Love her as a person, made me get a minor in Afro-Amer Studies.

Professor Adell was very passionate and tried to make lectures fun but really they were pretty boring and pointless. The class is a lot of reading. There are 10 books and you are graded on 4 papers. Some of the books were actually interesting and others were dreadful. Very sweet professor though.

Professor Adell's class was super interesting. It was mainly discussions about the book we read before coming in so it felt more like a forum than a class. It was super engaging and I enjoyed the conversations my peers and I had. There is definitely a lot of reading, but staying on top of it from the start helps a ton. Few writing assignments.

Professor Adell was one of the sweetest and inspiring professors I've had. She was super understanding and accommodating to the fact that classes switched to online. She always made class super fun and interesting. We had great discussions. I would recommend this class! A few papers here and there but nothing too bad.

Had a lot of reading and writing, but it's a literature class so,,, probably should be expected. She's super fun and relaxed though, she kept class periods over zoom pretty chill and enjoyable. You can tell she really cares about her students!
Shes a very kind and knowledgeable professor, she gives extensions pretty easily. Her class is fun and shes hilarious, this was easily my best class this semester
Only had 4 assignments, each 100 points. She chose great material and every class was just a discussion about the plays. Really good class, highly recommend and Im a stem major

This class was fairly easy. The books are good, but the themes are quite repetitive making it hard to actually read as the semester goes on. Prof Adell is kind of a wildcard; she was fun/caring in some classes but very combative in others. Assignments and essay prompts aren't too clear, but she's a generous grader so it cancels out.

Bad grader, don't waste your time with this class. She expects 1/4th to 1/2th a book read per class and isn't afraid to call you out by name. I got anxiety walking in the classroom even when I had done the reading. A few of the novels selected were excellent, but the class as a whole was a bad experience.

Drop the course. Went to the first day of class and she just went straight into lecture and assigned a play on the first day of class. Gets off topic easily. If youre into reading and theatre youll love the class; if youre just trying to fulfill a requirement, take a better class honesty.

Professor Adell inspired me to continue in my writing, writing several kind comments on my papers that I have cut out and saved. She herself is a gifted writer and offered some tips that really helped me. I loved her class and it convinced me to take an AfroAmer minor.
Easy class, you just have to read a small play almost every week. Graded on 3 essays and a final. Entertaining lectures - show up and read the books and youll be fine

She is honestly one of the best humans out there! Professor Adell brings light to many issues on campus and in the world. I think that this was a more difficult Ethnic studies course but honestly it was worth what I learned from her! Love her! I would love to take another course with her.

Professor Adell was an inspiring teacher. She changed my perspective on a lot of issues and made our African American history real, not just something we read in a textbook. You do read a book a week, but they are usually short. If you read the book and go to class you will get an easy A while learning a lot. 1 paper, 2 exams, and participation

Professor Adell is very knowledgeable but the lectures were too long  and it wasn't clear was exactly was expected of us. The content was interesting but basically just a plot summary of every book we read
She is a great professor. She really opened my eyes to the subject matter, and was very engaging in lecture. I would recommend taking her class.

She's far too subjective with her paper grading. She didn't give back the first assignment until after we turned in the second one, so we had no reference. She cancelled the final, which was good and bad. Less work, but less of a chance to improve grades. Really loves theater and gets off-topic about it. Very smart, but rather pretentious.
Adell provides a clear analysis of the texts read for class, and she includes articles or other relevent pieces of history to explain the novelsauthors.

Easiest class, take this class to get your ethnic studies requirement out of the way and get your GPA up. As long as you go to lectures and discussions and do your readings (its usually one short book per week, suck it up) you'll get an A. Professor Adell's lectures are engaging and she is hilarious.
Very Knowledgeable about the topic and any related topics. She was very helpful on paper writing. I have recommended this class to many of my friends. She also picked very interesting books.

Unclear in lecture, uses vulgar words in response to student work, objects to any opinion that's not hers. Hard to know what is expected in assignments or what is to be graded. Large amount of reading, especially for an introductory level class. Emotionally difficult material. A misfortune for anyone who has to take this class.

You meet for one lecture a week for an hour and 40 min and have one discussion. Attendance and participation are mandatory. Two papers and a final. Grades aren't posted online so if you don't go to discussion you don't know where you're at in the class. She's very passionate about what she teaches. Reading load is brutal.

Ms Adell is a very sweet, kind-hearted woman, but this semester I found her to be lacking in clarity. She would often assign something but never give any criteria, expectations or examples. On the plus side, in the event that you do not do well on an assignment she is always there to help you improve your grade. Be ready to read a bookplay a week

Guidelines not clear and changed/added more at the last minute. Not helpful, rude and very opinionated. Grades not returned in a timely fashion and has an unfair grading practice. Not professional by any means. Lectures had nothing to do with exams. I do not advise taking this class or any class with her as the professor.

I enjoyed working with Prof. Adell! She is an actor as well as a professor by trade, so class was really engaging. I think this may have been one of the courses from which I learned the most. I loved almost all of the books we read.

This is such an interesting class and instructor.  She is not your typical buttoned up professor.  The readings can be a bit emotionally tough at times, but they really make you think.  The class has given me a broader understanding and history and humanity.
Really interesting class. Adell is a really passionate professor who engages the class well. The tests are graded super easily and its a good class to take for ethnic studies.

She's very passionate about what she teaches. At first I was scared of the reading load, but the books were all very interesting. Her midterm incorporates lots of material, but if you know the main ideas you will get credit. She's a very easy grader. Would recommend to anyone who needs an ethnic study and a literature!

In lecture, she tends to ramble and jump from topic to topic, so you might have trouble deciphering your note for tests. Fairly easy grader, if you read the books and go to class you'll have no problem.
Questions on essays/exams are ridiculous. Too wordy, ask you to address too many things at once, or just have little to do with the text. Fortunately they are not graded very hard.

Professor Addell has one of the most powerful presences of any teacher. She is passionate. Her assignments are unclear, but all that matters is that you are thoughtful and know some African American history. She enjoys if you come in and talk to her during office hours.

A little bit scatterbrained at times, although incredibly smart.  Doesn't remember names very well.  You should be prepared for the classes and you will get an A.  Vague on the assignments.  Easy to talk to.

Crazy intelligent, methodological, impressive, personable, & she's the only prof I know who asks students to read their papers to the class (as example of ways to style and craft a paper). Indispensable.

Prof Adell is very smart and has a wide range of knowlege. She has her flaws as a teacher and dont expect to have the most straight-foward description of assignments. Despite this if you put in effort, read the books (somewhat) and particpate you will have an enjoyable semester and get a good grade.
Prof Adell is ridiculously smart, and very willing to help out.  She is a tremendoues resource to the university.

Very smart woman. Dramatic in her teaching styles because she herself is an actress. I myself am taking another class she offers next semester. You must go to class and you must read, but readings are good and make you think.
Watch her. She will turn on the class at the drop of a dime. Mostly graduate students. She is not interested in helping you succeed.

She really makes Intro to Afro-American literature fun.  Class is laid back.  All you do is read the assigned plays, discuss them, and write 3 short papers.  She is a great prof. who really gets into the class.
